properties.Title: Freezing Rain Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: The freezing rain will end in the next few hours. ### Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots will become icy, slippery and hazardous. There may be a significant impact on rush hour traffic in urban areas. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Significant snowfall expected Wednesday night into Thursday. A low pressure system moving into northwestern Ontario Wednesday night will bring potentially significant snowfall to the region. Snowfall is expected to begin overnight on Wednesday and continue until Thursday evening. Total snowfall amounts of 15 cm are possible. Snowfall warnings may be required. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-03-11T11:00:04-00:00

It will end later today. ### Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become icy and slippery. properties.Title: Extreme Cold Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A period of very cold wind chills is expected. Clear, cold conditions with winds up to 30 km/h will lead to extremely cold wind chill values near -55 tonight and Wednesday morning. Rising temperatures and easing winds through the day Wednesday will moderate wind chills. ### Extreme cold puts everyone at risk. Watch for cold related symptoms: shortness of breath, chest pain, muscle pain and weakness, numbness and colour change in fingers and toes. Extreme cold warnings are issued when very cold temperatures or wind chill creates an elevated risk to health such as frost bite and hypothermia. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2020-03-11T11:22:10-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-10T19:23:10-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3704851588.2020
Area: Resolute
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blowing Snow Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snow combined with strong winds will reduce visibilities through this evening. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility. Blowing snow advisories are issued when winds are expected to create blowing snow giving poor visibility to 800 metres or less for at least 3 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.

properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Elevated pollution levels are expected or occurring. DUST ADVISORY IN EFFECT FOR GOLDEN THE MINISTRY OF ENVIRONMENT (AMPERSAND)CLIMATE CHANGE STRATEGY IN COLLABORATION WITH THE INTERIOR HEALTH AUTHORITY HAS CONTINUED A DUST ADVISORY FOR GOLDEN DUE TO HIGH CONCENTRATIONS OF DUST THAT ARE EXPECTED TO PERSIST FOR THE NEXT 12 HOURS. EXPOSURE IS PARTICULARLY A CONCERN FOR PREGNANT WOMEN, INFANTS, THE ELDERLY AND THOSE WHO HAVE UNDERLYING MEDICAL CONDITIONS SUCH AS BREATHING OR LUNG CONDITIONS, HAY FEVER, ASTHMA OR PERSONS WHO REACT STRONGLY TO DUST. IF YOU ARE EXPERIENCING SYMPTOMS SUCH AS CONTINUING EYE OR THROAT IRRITATION, CHEST DISCOMFORT, SHORTNESS OF BREATH, COUGH OR WHEEZE, FOLLOW THE ADVICE OF YOUR HEALTH CARE PROVIDER. REAL-TIME AIR QUALITY OBSERVATIONS AND INFORMATION REGARDING THE HEALTH EFFECTS OF AIR POLLUTION CAN BE FOUND AT HTTPS://WWW2.GOV.BC.CA/GOV/CONTENT/ENVIRONMENT/AIR-LAND-WATER/AIR. FOR MORE INFORMATION ON CURRENT AIR QUALITY, VISIT WWW2.GOV.BC.CA/GOV/CONTENT/ENVIRONMENT/AIR-LAND-WATER/AIR. VISIT WWW.AIRHEALTH.CA FOR INFORMATION ON HOW TO REDUCE YOUR HEALTH RISK AND YOUR PERSONAL CONTRIBUTION TO POLLUTION LEVELS, AS WELL AS FOR CURRENT AND FORECAST AQHI VALUES. PLEASE CONTINUE TO MONITOR ALERTS AND FORECASTS ISSUED BY ENVIRONMENT CANADA. HTTP://WEATHER.GC.CA ### For more information on current air quality, visit www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/environment/air-land-water/air. Visit www.airhealth.ca for information on how to reduce your health risk and your personal contribution to pollution levels, as well as for current and forecast AQHI values. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2020-03-11T02:38:19-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, the B.C. Ministry of Environment, 2020-03-10T18:40:19-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2153370922.2020
Area: East Columbia
properties.Author: Environment Canada, the B.C. Ministry of Environment

properties.Title: Alberta Emergency Alert - Train Accident Alert Updated
properties.Summary:
Description: The State of Local Emergency and evacuation has been lifted for the community of Swalwell. Swalwell residents are asked to refer to the re-entry map, available on the Kneehill County website, prior to returning to their homes. The Reception Center located at the Prairie Bible Institute Cafeteria, 350 5th Ave North in Three Hills, will remain open for residents until 3:30 pm. ### Go to www.kneehillcounty.com for updates and more information, or call 403-443-5541.
Expires: 2020-03-17T15:02:08-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Kneehill County, 2020-03-10T15:00:18-06:00, NAADS-CA-AB-AEA1-6250
Area: Kneehill County
properties.Author: Kneehill County
